title: 5G Towers locations and Heath and Safety Risk Assessment

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please confirm:
1. how many 5G towers have been fitted in the City of Sheffield?
2. How may are LIVE and switched on (if not all) ?
3. Who owns them? e.g Three 5G, O2 5G, Vodafone 5G, EE 5G ?
4. Please provide a copy of :
a. The Health and Safety Risk Assessment ?
b. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
c. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
Yours faithfully,
Leonard of the Harpin family

Dear Leonard Harpin,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 5G Towers which we
received on 30/01/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 27/02/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Leonard <[FOI #944080 email]>
Sent: 30 January 2023 16:12
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - 5G Towers locations and Heath
and Safety Risk Assessment
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please confirm:
1. how many 5G towers have been fitted in the City of Sheffield?
2. How may are LIVE and switched on (if not all) ?
3. Who owns them? e.g Three 5G, O2 5G, Vodafone 5G, EE 5G ?
4. Please provide a copy of :
a. The Health and Safety Risk Assessment ?
b. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
c. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
Yours faithfully,
Leonard of the Harpin family

Dear Leonard Harpin,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 5G Towers which we
received on 30/01/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We do not record if a tower is 5G or not but we have run a search where
the proposal contains 5G. Any information and documents we have can be
found by entering the application reference number at the following link:
[1]Simple Search (sheffield.gov.uk)
Please note that we do not request for Environmental Impact Assessments
for 5G mast applications.

If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI, Sheffield City Council representatives.
The information provide is missing :
1. The Health and Safety Risk Assessment ?
2. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
3. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
the part information provided also makes no sense?
Please provide the information asked for. Here it is again...
5G masts fitted in the City of Sheffield
1. The Health and Safety Risk Assessment ?
2. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
3. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
Yours sincerely,
Leonard of the Harpin family

Dear Leonard Harpin,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to 5G
Towers which we received on 06/03/2023. We are sorry to hear that you are
not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Code of Practice – Environmental Information Regulations 2004 states
that we must respond to your request for internal review within 40 working
days, by 04/05/2023, but we kindly ask for your patience as we anticipate
that there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Leonard <[FOI #944080 email]>
Sent: 06 March 2023 14:48
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Internal review of Freedom of Information request - 5G Towers
locations and Heath and Safety Risk Assessment
Dear FOI, Sheffield City Council representatives.
The information provide is missing :
1. The Health and Safety Risk Assessment ?
2. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
3. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
the part information provided also makes no sense?
Please provide the information asked for. Here it is again...
5G masts fitted in the City of Sheffield 1. The Health and Safety Risk
Assessment ?
2. The Environmental Impact Analysis ?
3. and the Insurance Policy for the equipment ?
Yours sincerely,
Leonard of the Harpin family
show quoted sections

Dear Leonard Harpin,
Internal Review of Environmental Information Regulations Request –
Reference – EIR / 828251
Thank you for your email requesting a review of Sheffield City Council’s
response to your Environmental Information Regulations request. We
endeavour to provide a response to internal reviews within 40 working
days. However, a review can sometimes be delayed and I apologise for this.
I can now confirm that a full and impartial review of the decision made in
this case has been conducted with a summary as follows:
You contacted the council on 30^th January 2023, requesting information
relating to 5G Towers. The response that you received on the 27^th
February 2023 provided information relating to the questions raised.
Your email received by the Council on 6^th March 2023 explained that you
were requesting an internal review of the above response due to missing
information and lack of clarity around the information provided.
I have reviewed the details of your complaint and have determined that
firstly, the Council is in breach of the timescales required for
processing an internal review. This should have been completed within 40
working days,  and we have taken nine months to reply. We sincerely
apologise for this but we have had a significant backlog of requests that
is taking us a long time to get through.
Addressing the content of your complaint, I can confirm that the position
outlined in the original response provided should be upheld. SCC doesn’t
record specific information regarding the type of tower (i.e 4G or 5G)
just that there is a tower. The information that you were provided with as
part of your initial response was the results of a search of proposals
where the applicant has stated it’s 5G.
SCC does not hold information relating to questions 2, 3 and 4.
If you are dissatisfied with my review, you can make a complaint to the
Information Commissioner’s Office: [1][
email address
]
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [2][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail
